She joined CEVI because she wanted to gain access to the financial services offered by the organization. Marabella is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more merchandise to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, detergents, personal care products and others. She believes that this loan could help her realize her dream of improving her business and her income as well.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, detergents, personal care products and others.

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak is 29 years of age and lives in the Baray district with her spouse and three children who attend school. To make a livelihood, she is in the farming business, where the major income is made to cover her daily costs. She has been doing this for over 10 years now. She has her husband who always gives great assistance in maintaining this type of business.

Due to insufficient capital, she is now asking for a loan of 700,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers to apply on her rice crops. This purchase will give a good growth to her rice, thus offer a higher production. Someday she hopes to experience a better quality of life as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to apply on her rice crops.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Purevsuren, 42 years old, lives with her mother and son in an apartment in the Khan-uul district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her son is a high school student.  

Since 1995, Purevsuren has worked in the "National Center for Infectious Diseases With Natural Foci" as a laboratory technician. Now, however, she is planning to start her own private business selling beauty products. 

She needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase beauty product inventory for her retail beauty shop. She is a hardworking woman who says, ''I will spend the profits from my business on my son's tuition.''

loans.use: To purchase beauty product inventory for her retail beauty shop.

loans.name: Oung

texts.en:
Oung, 24, is a hard-working woman who dedicates herself to a rice farming business as her main source of income. She owns around two hectares of farmland, on which she grows and harvests rice. She can earn about 8,000 KHR per day, whereas her husband earns 16,000 KHR from a recycling business. 

Oung is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to purchase a used motorcycle, which can be used both for home use as well as for the recycling business (transporting recycled materials back and forth to the market). She hopes this loan will be approved, so that she can better her standard of living. She is hoping for financial stability someday.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle, which can be used both for home use as well as for a recycling business (transporting recycled materials back and forth to the market).

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. She owns a restaurant, a business she has been operating for some time now. She also sells food stuffs from her home.

Salim is applying for a new loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase flour, meat, food flavoring, and other necessary items. The extra income from this loan will be saved to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, meat, food flavoring, and other necessary items.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 3. Felisa has been in the business of hog raising and basket weaving for 2 years now.  Her husband drives and does work as a carpenter to help in raising their family.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy commercial feed and piglets so she can increase her income. Her profit will be for her family's healthy diet and school fees. 

In the future, Felisa would like to have a bigger barn for her hogs and have other business options to make a better profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy commercial feed and piglets

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. Jacqueline set up a spare parts shop in order to bring building materials nearer to her community and also earn income to support her family. Since there are only three people dealing in the business in her village, she is assured of customers. She is faced with the challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and theft.

Jacqueline never got a chance to go to the University but wishes to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and buy land to grow crops. She is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha has been managing her preparatory school for the past 5 years and she is loved by all her companions there. Her husband, who works as a teacher, helps with the family expenses. Mwanaisha is a very honest and responsible person.

She is requesting a loan to renovate some classrooms. Her biggest dream is to improve her school and attract more pupils.

loans.use: to renovate some classrooms

loans.name: Damdin-Ochir

texts.en:
Damdin-Ochir is a 23-year-old guy who lives with his mother and sister in the outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His family lives in a small house, which is very old. The windows and some parts of the house let the wind blow through, so the house needs some renovation work. Thus he requests a Kiva loan from kind lenders. 

With this loan he will purchase the necessary construction materials to make better living conditions for his sister and mother. He is the only man of his family, so he is very hardworking and ambitious to have a good life.

loans.use: to renovate his old, unsafe house.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila runs a sari-sari or convenience store in their place in Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in this business for more than five years now.
As of this time, Nila needs funds for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan worth 6,000 PHP to purchase more stock to sell such as detergents, shampoo, snack foods, canned and dry goods, etc. Nila believes that if she will be provided with financial support through this loan, she can finally make dreams come true.

In the future, Nila wants to see her business be a successful one.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as detergents, shampoo, snack foods, canned and dry goods, etc.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 23 years old and from the community of Maribojoc, Bohol.  She is married with two young children ages 1 and 2. She is helping her husband, who is a farmer, by buying and selling coconut wine. She is determined to make her business successful.

She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine, tungog (food coloring that gives coconut wine its maroon color and bitter taste that helps the natural fermentation) and five-gallon containers. This way she can accommodate more orders from her customers.

In the future, she hopes to have another means to earn an income for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine, food coloring and five-gallon containers

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from Gardabani district, East Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, David. David takes wood from the forest and sells it in his village and nearby villages. 

Nino runs a small dairy business. In particular, she has a milk cow and produces cheese, which is sold locally. Nino has been involved in this type of business for over ten years and has a rich experience in her job.

She has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase additional milk cows. This will allow Nino to obtain more milk for her dairy and increase the sales of her production. Nino will have an opportunity to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a 46-year-old farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice for an income. She is working hard to support the needs of her four children ages 10, 14, 18 and 19. Analiza is dependent on her harvest after every four months to support her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm so she can have a good harvest of rice for both consumption and profit.
 
In the future, she hopes to till more land so she can farm more crops for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Chot

texts.en:
Chot is 53 years old and married with eight children. It’s quite a big family, which sometimes causes her to experience financial difficulties due to the high cost of commodities. Chot, however, tries hard to be dedicated to her retail business, from which she is able to make approximately 32,000 KHR each day. She loves doing her business because she can build a good communication with people in her community. She has been operating this since 2010. 

Chot plans to increase stock of her merchandise to satisfy her customers’ needs, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase items such as noodles, spices, powders, shampoos, beverages, snack foods, cosmetics, kitchen supplies, and other household products to sell. She says that the loan will enable her to improve her current stock, and she hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like noodles, spices and shampoos to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 50 years old and a mother of 3 children. She and her family live in the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. She is used to farming, since having her family this has been their source of livelihood. Like most couples, she and her husband work together and strive hard to meet the needs of their family. 

She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She requested a loan to be used in buying quality seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for labor. The extra income that Andrea can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption and reinvestment in the business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Thath

texts.en:
Thath lives in a peaceful village of Baray district with her single child, while her older child is settled for marriage and lives separately. Thath is 48 years old and a widow who devotes her full attention to a rice farming business. It’s the sole source of her income. She also has her child help her manage their rice field. She has been in this business for almost 10 years, earning approximately 8,000 KHR each day.

Thath would like to gain access to financial support to make her business more profitable, so she needs additional capital of 300 USD to purchase a plot of farmland. She hopes to increase to a higher production from her rice field in years to come. With the generated income, she will reinvest back to her business to further develop it towards the attainment of her goals.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. This is the source of their income. She works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Now she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish to the market.

Anecita dreams of improving their lives. Moreover, she wants to continue to send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 45 years old. She supports her family by farming rice. She is married with three children ages 7, 12 and 14. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband helped each other in tilling the land hoping for a good harvest. She applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, quality seedlings, and to pay for labor. They are expecting a better yield on their crops for having the means now to buy the needed farming maintenance. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family's daily consumption and future business investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, quality seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Yaovi est un jeune revendeur d’huile à moteur  âgé de 25 ans. Père de 02 enfants dont un (01) seul est scolarisé, il a débuté cette activité en 2010 et ne dispose que d’un étalage précaire. Il sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour augmenter la quantité de marchandise et renforcer son activité. Ceci lui permettra d’ouvrir  un point de vente et assurer le bien être sanitaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yaovi is a young, 25-year-old man who resells motor oil. He is father to two children, just one of whom is at school. He began this business in 2010, and only has one somewhat flimsy stall.

Yaovi has requested his first loan from WAGES to increase the quantity of products he offers, as well as to consolidate his business. This will allow him to open a point of sale, and to ensure that his family’s health is provided for.

loans.use: To buy motor oil.

loans.name: Samansarith's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Kror kor district of Pursat province, Samansarith is 58 years old and she is a single woman. To make a living, she has worked as a wedding planner for thirty years. Lack of working capital to support her current business is still the main challenge for her family.

Samansarith has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has successfully repaid the past loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood. 

Now she and her group members are asking for a loan of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy decorative materials for supporting her current business. She hopes this loan will enable her business to grow so as to increase her family's income to make their living better.

loans.use: To buy decorative materials.

loans.name: Ploung's Group

texts.en:
Ploung is aged 32 years and married. She and her husband live in a village located in the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia. The main source of her family’s income is rice farming, which she has been in for almost 10 years. She supplements her income by raising pigs. From the current business, she is able to earn about 22,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about KHR 15,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Ploung’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is in her second loan with VisionFund. The past loan she took from VisionFund helped her relieve the family’s burden. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, Ploung will use her portion to buy a buffalo for using in her rice paddy. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her rice production to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for using in her rice paddy.

loans.name: Madeleine Rosine

texts.fr: Rosine est une jeune femme agée de 34 ans, fiancée, mère d'enfants . Elle a un café-restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 7 ans déjà dans un quartier de la capitale. Elle achète le plus souvant les aliments de son café-restaurant en détail(riz, huile poisson, lait, sardines., oeufs...), elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de ces aliments (en gros)ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi de réaliser un bénéfice plus élévé qui l'aidera à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens de sa  famille et aussi d'agrandir son restaurant avec le temps.
texts.en:
Rosine is a young woman who is 34 years of age, engaged, and a mother. She has a café-restaurant which she has run for the past seven years, located in a neighborhood in the capital. She often purchases food for her café-restaurant on a retail basis (rice, fish oil, milk, sardines, eggs). 

Rosine has requested this loan to increase her stocks of these food items (on a wholesale basis). This will allow her not only to satisfy her ever-growing customer base, but also to generate higher profits. This will help Rosine to cover some of her family’s daily needs, as well as to expand her restaurant over time.

loans.use: To buy a carton of milk, sardines, and trays of eggs.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi est couturier et père de 02 enfants tous scolarisés, respectivement âgés  de 07 ans et 04 ans. Âgé de 31 ans, Il est marié à une coiffeuse. Dans le souci de réaménager son atelier afin de réinvestir son activité, il sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour associer à la couture la revente des tissus et  aussi pour assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Koffi works making clothes, and is a father to two children. His children are 7 and 4 years of age, and they are both at school. 

Koffi himself is 31 years old, and is married to a hairdresser. In order to refurbish his workshop and reinvest in his business, he has requested his first loan from WAGES. He will use the money to add the resale of fabrics to his business making clothes, as well as to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: To refurbish his workshop.

loans.name: Thany's Group

texts.en:
Thany lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 33 and married with four dependent children, one daughter and three sons, all of whom are still in school. To support the family, she has been in raising pigs for ten years. She supplements the family's income through seeding rubber trees for sale and also selling grocery items at home. Her husband is a policeman. The low price of rubber seedlings and pigs in the market are still the main challenges for her business. 

Thany, the group leader, has had two loans with VisionFund, while the other member has had three loans from VisionFund. She completely repaid the past loans which have helped her relieve her family's burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,400,000 Riel (KHR) each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pig feed, and to take care of rubber seedlings. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal, 44, is married with five children, three of whom are dependent on him and still in school. He lives in a rural area of Kandal province's Kandal stoeng district, Cambodia. Rice farming has been his main source of income for twenty years. The current business earns him approximately 20,000 Riel (KHR) per day to meet his family's needs. 

Phal's group, for which he is the leader, consists of three members who live in the same village. He has had one previous loan from VisionFund. He successfully paid back that loan, which has helped him relieve his family's burden. Now he and his group members are applying for a loan of 160,000 KHR each. He is going to use his portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine such as latrine bowl, tile draining and sewage etc. He hopes this loan will enable his family have a healthy latrine so as to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine

loans.name: Jose La Rosa

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos, no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con su amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Chicharrón de Chancho para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día José trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, tales como gaseosas y cervezas, todas las mañanas desde tempranas hora inicia su labor, él puede dedicar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias a su negocio y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como cervezas, gaseosas, bebidas energizantes, agua mineral, entre otras; de esta manera José tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco le servirán de mucho asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños, ya que sueña en verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
José, 35, lives in Ica with his wife and two young children.  He is a friendly man, enthusiastic and hard-working, and--along with his wife--doing everything in his power to support his family and get ahead in the world.  He would have liked to have studied for a paid career, he says, but he had to leave school early to help support his family.  In his spare time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also makes a delicious "chicharron de chancho" [a traditional pork dish] for family get-togethers.  José operates a small business selling drinks: beer and soft drinks, for example.  He opens the business early and works around 10 hours a day.  He says that the business is doing well because he provides his customers with a good service.
José says that he is grateful to you and other Kiva lenders because your loans will help him buy the merchandise--beer, soft drinks, energy drinks, mineral water, etc.--that he needs to stock his business.  He thinks the investment will increase his sales and, in turn, his income.  He wants to ensure that his children get a good education so that they can study for paid careers.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 38, lives with her family group composed of her life companion and their children. She operates a retail shop situated at her home. She has quite a large number of regular customers, since people seek her out because of the quality of her products, her affordable prices and above all for the welcoming service she offers; she is always at her customers' service. 

Jane is an active woman who is dedicated to her work. She is tenacious and above all a dreamer which is most important. She wants to reach each and every one of her goals which is why she works day to day with much effort and dedication because she knows that this is the only way to attain success. 

With thia loan, she will be able to add stock of flour, rice, sugar, and detergents.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, rice, sugar, and detergents.

loans.name: Terence Lesli

texts.fr: Lesli est une jeune femme de 37 ans mère d'enfants. Elle a ouvert et gere une petite parfumerie depuis 1 an deja. Grace a sa bonne experience elle a acquise une clientele loyale, mais la petitesse de son capital lui cause souvent des soucis de rupture permanent de stock de ses produits fars. D'ou son envie de renforcer son stock des laits et savons en achetant plusieurs cartons pour satisfaire sa clientele ainsi qu'un carton de mèches des cheveux, augmenter ses ventes, ainsi que ses benefices. Irene reinvestira une partie de son benefice pour encore agrandir sa parfumerie et le reste pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Lesli is a young, 37-year-old woman who is also a mother. She opened a small perfume store, which she has now run for one year. Thanks to her good experience, she has built up a loyal customer base. However, her low capital means that she often has permanent shortages of stocks of her most popular products. 

This is why Lesli wants to increase her stock of lotions and soaps by buying several boxes to satisfy her customers. She also plans to buy a box of hair extensions, which will allow her to increase her sales and profits. She will reinvest part of her profits in expanding her perfume store, and the rest will be used to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy boxes of lotions and soap and hair extensions.

loans.name: Wali

texts.fr: Mécanicien  des engins à deux roues et  revendeur  des pièces détachées, Monsieur Wali est un célibataire sans enfant de 25 ans. Il souhaite acheter et vendre de pièces détachées donc sollicite son premier prêt à WAGES pour financer son activité afin d’ouvrir des  boutiques et se marier plus tard.Il est aidé par 01 personne et exerce son activité dans un atelier.
texts.en:
Wali is a motorbike motor engineer and reseller of spare parts, and is 25 years of age. He is single, and has no children. 

Wali would like to buy and sell spare parts, and has therefore requested his first loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to finance his business, with the goal of opening a store and getting married in the future. He carries out his business in a workshop, where he is helped out by another person.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and engine oil.

loans.name: Manijay

texts.en:
Manijay, 46, is a mother of five children and is married. She has lived in Congo Town for the past seven years.

She has been selling bananas, peanuts, and oranges in her community. She is proud of her business because she earns her own income and assists her husband with the family's expenses. 

Manijay has requested this loan to purchase more bananas, peanuts, and oranges to increase her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, peanuts, and oranges to increase her business.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district of Cambodia, Phy is 48 years old and married with four children, three of whom are dependent on her and some are in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice on five hectares of farmland for several years and supplements her income by raising pigs. The current business earns her about 23,000KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000KHR each day for the future. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her paddy field.

Phy’s group consists of five members who are all female. This is her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Phy, who is the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will increase and become more profitable so as to increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 46 años, es soltera pero tiene tres hijos. Con ellos vive en la casa que compró gracias a sus años de trabajo.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica a cultivar plantas de cacao, tiene su propia parcela. Sus cosechas, las cuales realiza con el apoyo de jornaleros, las lleva a las sociedades recolectoras, quienes le pagan muy bien por la cantidad y buena calidad que obtiene. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean profesionales para que tengan un mejor futuro; para ello se esmera en seguir trabajando con sus cultivos, ya que sólo así puede solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida por apoyo que le brindan; así también, agradece a su banco comunal por la confianza que le dan y se responsabiliza en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo.
Con estos 2,500 nuevos soles comprará abono y otros fertilizantes para la buena producción de sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Maura, 46, and her three children live in a house that she was able to buy after many years of work.
She has operated a farming business for 20 years.  She owns her land and grows cacao.  She hires day laborers who help her harvest her crop and sells what she produces to local companies that pay very well for the quantity and quality of her cacao.  She puts all of her effort into her business so that she can support her children and pay their school fees.  Her greatest hope, she says, is that they study for paid careers so that they can have a better life.

This is Maura's first MFP loan and she is grateful, she says, for your help.  She also thanks her community bank for their confidence in her and says that she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.
Maura will use this 2,500 new soles loan to buy manure and other fertilizers for her next cacao crop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar. Her husband helps her with her organic vegetable trade business, which she started in 2009.  She has an organic vegetable storage pit and organic vegetable garden where she normally grows organic vegetables. However, this year, because she has a baby, she is unable to raise vegetables. She plans to resume growing organic vegetables next year. 

Alimaa is requesting a lona for 2,000,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase two tons of organic potatoes to use in her storage pit.  She received a prior loan, which she used to purchase a greenhouse to extend her growing season. She is working for her children's  future education.

loans.use: to purchase two tons of organic potatoes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 38 años, está casada con Raúl, de 41 años. Ellos compraron la casa donde ahora habitan junto a sus tres hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. 
Desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura y con el apoyo de su esposo lograron obtener su casa propia y una parcela con cultivos de cacao. Para ella, su labor es muy importante, ya que es la actividad que ha realizado durante varios años y sabe los problemas que obtendría si descuida sus cultivos. Sus cosechas le generan buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo que vende, pero aun así siempre necesita de un apoyo financiero para mejorar su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida con quienes apoyan su necesidad de trabajo, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago para que en otra oportunidad acceda a otro crédito.
Con estos 3,000 nuevos soles  comprará sacos de abono y fertilizantes. También contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Virginia, age 38, is married to 41 year old Raúl.  They bought the house they now live in with their three children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

She has been farming for 15 years, and with the support of her husband they managed to get their own house and a parcel of land with cacao crops.  Her work is very important to her.  It is a business activity that she has done for several years, and she knows the problems she will have if she neglects their crops.  Her crops generate good income for her for each kilogram that she sells.  Even so, she always needs financial support to improve her production.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is grateful to those who support her need to work.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments so that she can have another opportunity for a loan at another time.

She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy sacks of manure and fertilizers.  She will also hire day workers to help her with crop maintenance.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizers and to hire day workers to help her with crop maintenance.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been a rice farmer on one hectare of farmland for 20 years. She supplements the family’s income by raising pigs and working for others. Her current business earns about 20,000 KHR a day and she saves about 12,000 KHR a day after daily expenses. 

Thavy is requesting her first loan with VisionFund for $500, which she will use to buy fertilizers for her farmland, piglets, and pig feeds. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farmland​ and more piglets to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nadya

texts.es:
Nadya tiene 23 años, vive en la casa que compró junto a su pareja, Richard de 26 años, y con su pequeña hija, Cleydi de 7 años, a quien desean brindarle un mejor futuro.
Desde hace 5 años, junto a su pareja, se dedica al cultivo de plantas de cacao, en su propia parcela. En los tiempos de cosecha o mantenimiento, siempre cuentan con el apoyo de peones, ya que de esa manera pueden terminar su trabajo de manera rápida. Para ellos, su trabajo es muy importante, porque es lo que mejor saben hacer, y por otro lado, les genera buenas ganancias al comercializar sus granos de cacao. Sin embargo, las dificultades se presentan cuando los insectos interrumpen su buena producción. Es por eso que acuden a MFP para poder conseguir capital de inversión para sus cultivos.

Este es su primer crédito y se siente agradecida con la oportunidad, pues así continuará con su trabajo. También agradece la aceptación que le ha dado su banco comunal.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará abono, fertilizantes y una mochila fumigadora para poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Nadya, 23, lives with her partner, Richard, 26, and their young daughter, Cleydi, 7.  She hopes, she says, that she can provide her daughter with a better life.
Nadya and her partner have operated a farming business for 5 years.  They own their land and grow cacao.  They hire day laborers to help maintain and harvest their crop because, they say, it is the fastest way to work.  Nadya says that the business is important to her because it generates a good income and because it is, after all, what she best knows how to do.  Even so, it is often a tough business, subject to the vagaries of weather and insects that can reduce her yield.  She is applying to MFP for a loan that she will use to buy supplies for her next crop.

This is Nadya's first MFP loan and she says that she is grateful for your help because the loan will allow her to carry on her business.  She also thanks her community bank for their support.  
Nadya will use this 3,000 new soles loan to buy supplies--manure, fertilizers and a fumigator--for maintaining her cacao crop.

loans.use: to buys supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
Yobana tiene 23 años, su pareja es Oliver, de 24 años, tienen dos hijos. Juntos compraron una casa con el apoyo de sus padres y su trabajo. 
Ellos tienen 4 años trabajando en su parcela de cacao y plantas de naranja. Todos los días, por la mañana, se dirigen a su chacra para realizar la limpieza de sus plantas (quitar la maleza), pero en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros para que le ayuden a extraer de manera más rápida los frutos, lo cuales vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Su deseo es seguir mejorando su producción y para ello acude a MFP.

Este es su primer crédito y agradece por el apoyo, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, para que en otra oportunidad logre acceder a otro crédito. 
Con estos 500 nuevos soles comprará abono para el cuidado y mejora de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Yobana is 23 years old. Her partner Oliver is 24. They have two children. They bought a home together with help from their parents and their work.

They have been working on their plots of cocoa and orange trees for four years. Every morning they head out to their farm to clear their crops (pull weeds), but during the harvest season they hire laborers to help collect the fruit more quickly. She sells it at the local distribution centers. Her wish is to keep improving production and that is why she has come to MFP.

This is her first loan and she appreciates the support. That is why she promises to pay her installments on time, so that she may access another loan in the future.

She will use these 500 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer in order to care for and improve her plants.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to care for and improve her plants.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
Don Silvino tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tienen dos hijos. Él se dedica desde hace 42 años al cultivo de caña de azúcar y de maíz, fue su padre quien le enseño a los 12 años de edad. Para comprar los productos que necesita, él se desplaza en una carreta halada por bueyes hasta el pueblo más cercano que esta a una hora y media de ida y regreso a su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro sacos de fertilizantes, herbicidas, pago de 10 personas para el cultivo de maíz y tres personas que le ayuden con el cultivo de caña. 

Con la inversión, podrá abonar la milpa y pagara la mano de obra para que le ayude a realizar el trabajo más rápido y sacar una mejor cosecha. Con el objetivo de brindar a su familia el alimento diario. Lo que desea es cultivar más cantidad de maíz y caña para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Silvino, 54, is married and has two children.  For 42 years, he has made a living growing sugar cane and maize, work that his father starting teaching him to do when he was just 12 years old.  He goes by cart, drawn by oxen, to the nearest town to buy the supplies that he needs, a trip that takes an hour-and-a-half, there and back.  

Don Silvino will use this Fundacion Campo loan to pay for the farm labor--10 workers to help with his maize crop and three with his cane crop--and the supplies--fertilizers, herbicides, etc.--that he needs for his farming business.  

The investment will cover the costs of preparing his fields and paying workers so that he can work faster and bring in a better crop.  His goal is to provide his family with a better living.  For the future, he wants to grow more maize and sugar cane so that he can improve his house.

loans.use: to pay for labor and supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 51 años, tiene cuatro hijos, quienes son el motivo de sus esfuerzos.
Ella se dedica a labrar la tierra desde hace 26 años, cultiva plantas de cacao. Cada año va mejorando su producción, ya que realiza cuidadosamente la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus plantas. Cuando llega el momento de echar abono lo hace sola o cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Su deseo a futuro es seguir mejorando e incrementando su producción para obtener mejores ganancias que el año anterior.

Este es primer su crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le brindan para seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, se siente contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal, ya que así compartirán la responsabilidad y solidaridad entre socios.
Con los 500 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old and has four children, who are the motivation behind her efforts.

She has been farming for 26 years and grows cocoa trees. Her production is improving every year, because she clears her crops and maintains her trees carefully. When it is time to apply fertilizer she does it on her own or with help from her children. Her wish for the future is to keep improving and increasing production so that she can obtain better profits than the previous year.

This is her first loan with MFP and she appreciates the support they offer for her to continue with her work plans. She is also happy to be a part of her communal bank, because its members share responsability and solidarity.

She will use the 500 nuevos soles from this loan to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Manuel Rafael

texts.es: El señor Manuel, Habitante del Municipio de Ticuantepe, Junto a su esposa ha salido adelante, recibe el apoyo de su hijos que ya estan mayores, el labora como conductor para una Institucion del estado, y tiene un taxi que da a trabajar para tener mas ingresos a su hogar. su sueño de toda la vida ha sido mejorar su casa y con este financiamiento podra ver su sueño cumplido, comprara los siguientes materiales para terminar parte de una pared: Bloques, Cemento, Hierro, Arena, Perlines. pagara mano de obra. muy contento el señor Manuel con Afodenic por el apoyo Brindado y a fondos Kivas que confian en el.
texts.en: Manuel, who is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe, has got ahead along with his wife. He receives support from his children, who are now adults. He works as a driver for a government organization and has a taxi which provides work in order to increase his household income. All his life his dream has been to improve his home, and this loan will allow him to see his dream come true. He will purchase the following materials in order to finish one wall section: blocks, cement, iron, sand, and purlines. He will pay for labor. Manuel is very happy with the support provided by Afodenic and Kiva funds, and appreciates their trust.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials: blocks, cement, iron, sand.

loans.name: Jose Donald

texts.es: El señor Jose, habita en el  Municipio de la Concepcion, su esposa labora para una empresa privada como Operaria y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, tiena a su cargo  su hijo pequeño y quiere darle mejores condiciones a su hijo, actualmente tiene 2 manzanas de Tierra con cultivo de Cafe  las cuales requieren de Mantenimiento, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara los siguientes insumos para la debida  mejora del Cafe: Fertilizante, Urea, Conter, Siprementina, Cobre, Gramonzon y mano de obra. con este  mantenimiento el cultivo dara mejores frutos con buen tamaño, color y jugosa para que al venderla se la pagen a buen precio. agradece a Afodenic quien atravez de Fondos Kivas lo han apoya por varios años.
texts.en: Sr. Jose lives in La Concepcion.  His wife works for a private company and her income helps pay for family expenses.  He has one young son and hopes that he can provide him with a better life.  Sr. Jose grows coffee on 2 "manzanas" [a unit of land area] of land.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to maintain his crop.  The funds will pay for the supplies--fertilizers, urea, [Conter, Siprementina, Cobre, Gramonzon are probably trade names]--he needs to run his business and pay his farm workers.  Good maintenance is the key to a crop that yields the best size, color and flavor and, in turn, the best price at market.  Sr. Jose says that he is grateful to Afodenic for providing these Kiva-supported loans because they have been an important source of help to his business for several years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Hodaridar Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mpala, représentante du groupe d’affaire Hodaridar, femme dynamique, âgée de 53 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants. Son mari fut décédé à la suite d’une maladie subite. La cliente est vendeuses d’huile de palme. Elle commença ses activités avec son fonds propre reçu par son défunt mari. Elle expose ses marchandises a l’entrée d’une avenue. La cliente évoque l’insuffisance du capital rotatif. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir de payer 5 bidons d’huile de palme. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, construire une belle maison et accroitre son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour soutenir les pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: Our client Mpala, the representative of the Hodaridar group is a dynamic 53-year woman, a widow and the mother of six. Her husband died following an illness. Mpala sells palm oil. She had launched her business with her own funds received from her late husband. She displays her wares at the beginning of a big  road. She reports not having enough working capital. This new loan will allow her to buy five jugs of palm oil. She would like to see her children grow and also to build a nice house and expand her business. She thanks Hekima and its partners for supporting impoverished women who do not have access to traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy five jugs of palm oil.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatima Mercedes

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven de comercio en la venta de ropa, cosméticos y ahora el alquiler de cuartos, siendo la casa de dos pisos, alquilando los cuartos de abajo, siendo su mama la administradora de este pequeño negocio, y la que siempre la apoyado para salir adelante con sus ventas de ropa al comenzar con capital propio que sus padres dieron.
Con los financiamientos se le facilito la compra en más cantidad de ropa y variedad, lo que logro crecer en inventario, obteniendo buenas ventas. Hoy en día tiene su pareja pero a un no tiene hijo.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara láminas de zinc,golosos, para cambiar parte del techo, que está ya muy viejo, se le pasa el agua y desea mejorar esta condición ya que se le es muy incomodo.
texts.en:
Fátima is a young retailer who sells clothing and cosmetics, and currently also rents rooms. Since she lives in a two-story house, she rents the rooms downstairs. Her mother manages this small business and has always helped her move forward with her clothing sales. She started out with capital provided by her parents.

Through financing she was able to purchase higher quantities and a wider variety of clothing, which allowed her to expand her inventory and increase sales. She currently has a partner but they don't have any children yet.

She will use this new loan to purchase zinc sheets and bolts in order to replace part of the roof, which is very old. Water leaks through and she wants to improve the situation because it is very uncomfortable.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting and bolts to replace part of the roof.

loans.name: Marío Roberto

texts.es:
Don Mario tiene 61 años de edad, es casado y tienen dos hijos. Él se dedica desde muy pequeño a la agricultura junto son su padre y sus hermanos. Por razones económicas en su familia, él no pudo asistir a la escuela, pues tenía que trabajar mucho. A sus 20 años se caso y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta para mantener a su familia. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas se desplaza a tres kilómetros de su casa, paga un vehiculo para transportarse, luego traslada la mercadería en una carreta durante un kilómetro hasta el lugar donde tiene sus cultivos.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, para cultivar 7,000 metros de maíz. Con la inversión pretende mejorar su producción para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. En un futuro desea ampliar la cantidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Mario is 61 years old, married, and has two children. He started farming as a very young child, along with his parents and siblings. Due to his family's financial situation, he was not able to go to school, because he had to work a lot. He got married when he was twenty years old and started working on his own to support his family. In order to purchase farm supplies, he travels nearly two miles from his home. He pays for a vehicle to transport him and then carries the merchandise in a cart over half a mile to the place where he has his crops.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase fertilizer so that he can grow corn on .16 acres of land. He intends to increase production with this investment in order to improve his family's living standards. In the future he wants to expand his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizantes for his corn field, which is .16 acres.

loans.name: Celsa Dinora

texts.es:
Celsa tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y tienen un hijo. Ella desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a ayudar a su padre en la agricultura. Debido a que su familia era muy numerosa y ella era la mayor a sus 19 años se caso y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta en compañía de su esposo. Al paso de los años, su esposo la abandono y ella tomo las riendas de su hogar; hoy en día cultiva 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz con la ayuda de su hijo que aún es menor de edad.

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas se desplaza a cuatro kilómetros de su casa, paga un vehiculo para transportarse, y de esta forma realizar sus compras. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos para la agricultura. Con la inversión pretende mejorar su producción para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Su deseo es que su hijo finalice sus estudios con una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Celsa is 51 years old, married, and has one child. Since she was very young, she has helped her father work in agriculture. Since her family was large and she was the oldest, she married at 19 years old and started working on her own in her husband's company. As the years went on, her husband left her and  she took the reins of her home; today, she cultivates 10,500 square meters of corn with the help of her son who is still a minor.

In order to buy agricultural inputs, she travels four kilometers from her house and pays a car to transport her, and in this way is able to make her purchases.

The loan that she is asking for from Fundacion Campo is to purchase fertilizer and other agricultural inputs. With this investment, she seeks to increase her production in order to increase the standard of living of her family. Her wish is that her son completes his studies at a university.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other products for agriculture

loans.name: Agossa

texts.fr: Agossa célibataire sans enfant et âgé de 33 ans est revendeur d’huile à moteur depuis 2008. Disposant d’une boutique et aidé par 01 seul employé, il sollicite un second prêt dans notre institution afin d’acheter et de revendre une plus grande quantité de marchandise mais aussi de diversifier les produits de son activité. Il désire ainsi ouvrir des succursales et améliorer l’état de santé de ses parents avec les profits qu'il réalisera.
texts.en: Agossa is single without children. He is 33 years old and has been selling engine oil since 2008. He has a store where he is aided by one employee. He is seeking his second loan from our institution in order to buy a larger stock for resale but also to diversify his products. He would like to open other branches and help with his parents’ healthcare costs thanks to his revenues.

loans.use: to buy engine oil.

loans.name: Julio Adalberto

texts.es:
Julio tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida. Él lleva aproximadamente un año de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado, fue su papá quien le enseño, pues solía acompañarlo al tianque cuando su papá asistía los días miércoles. Compra y vende ganado los días miércoles en un tianque que esta a unos veinte kilómetros de su casa, él y otras personas pagan transporte para trasladar el ganado  y ahorrarse unos cuantos dólares. Sale de su casa a las 5:00 a.m. y regresa a la 1:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos terneras. Así,  las alimentara y cuidara hasta que estén en gestación y venderlas a un precio más alto, Julio manifiesta que si no es por el crédito se le hará difícil reunir todo el dinero para comprarlas. Del ingreso adicional que le quede de la venta del ganado, lo ahorrara para construir una habitación en su casa.
texts.en:
Julio is 21 years old and lives with his life companion. He has been working in the buying and selling of cattle for about a year. It was his father that taught him, since he used to accompany his father to the market when he went on Wednesdays. He buys and sells cattle on Wednesdays in a market that is 20 kilometers from his house. He and others pay together for transport to move the cattle and save themselves some money. He leaves his house at 5:00am and returns at 1:00pm.

The loan that he is asking for from Fundacion Campo is to purchase two calves. He will feed them and take care of them until they are in gestation and then sell them at a higher price. Julio says that if it wasn't for the loan, he would have a tough time getting the money together to buy them. With the additional investment that he will get from the sale of the cattle, he will save in order to build a new addition to his house.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is 54 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. The main source of the family’s income is rice farming on two hectares of farmland. Chantha has done this for 25 years and supplements their income by working as a paid worker. Chantha is able to earn about 14,000KHR per day and manages to save about 6,000KHR of it. Drought is still the main challenge for her rice business.

Chantha is the leader of a group that consists of two female members who live in the same village. She is the first client with VisionFund. Now she and her group member are asking for a loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000KHR each. Chantha is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor costs for transplanting rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business and set aside some money to start a new business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Doña Karla labora en un hospital, ella es madre soltera, y con muchos deseos de seguir adelante en la educación de su hija el cual estudia el 5to grado de la primaria, así mismo tener un techo digno que le dé mejor seguridad  a su pequeña. Vive en casa de sus padres, en un cuarto aparte, que ha venido mejorando.

Las mejoras se le han hecho posibles a corto plazo, con financiamiento en Afodenic, con este nuevo préstamo comprara: quince láminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, clavos, para reparar el techo y dejarlo solido ya que no está bien pegado, lo que le preocupa en este invierno ya que son con muchos vientos, y comenzar lo más pronto posible la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Karla works in a hospital. She is a single mother with dreams of getting ahead in the education of her daughter, who studies in the fifth grade. She also wants to have a decent ceiling which will give her little girl more security. She lives in her parents' house, in a separate room which she has been fixing up.

The improvements that she has done have been those that were possible to do in the short term with financing from Afodenic. With this new loan she will purchase 15 zinc plates, wooden beams, and nails in order to repair the roof and leave it solid since it's not well-assembled. She is worried about the winter since it is very windy, and wants to begin the work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase zinc plates, wood, and nails in order to improve the ceiling of her room.

loans.name: Mercy Yanet

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercy, tiene 55 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y aun viven en su casa. El marido se dedica al comercio. 

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días preparando desayunos y almuerzos, siempre varia el menú a preferencia de sus clientes con la finalidad de que ellos se sientan conformes de degustar sus deliciosos alimentos que  ofrece, allí trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos que son los encargados  de servir y cobrar los platos mientras que ella está en la cocina cocinando y sirviendo los alimentos. Lleva más de 9 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar unas sillas, mesas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
The “Camino Al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton that’s known for its pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renowned both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Mercy, 55, lives here.  She’s married and has four children who are all adults now but still live at home.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a small restaurant at home where she works every day cooking breakfast and lunch.  She always varies the menu in order to insure that her customers feel satisfied enjoying her delicious food.  She works there with help from her children who are in charge of serving and collecting payment for the dishes while she’s busy in the kitchen cooking and plating the dishes.  She’s been in business more than 9 years and does very well.

She will use the loan to buy some tables, chairs and foodstuffs to prepare the meals.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and is the sergeant at arms; she likes it because the loans help her very much.  Her goal is to continue forward and to have more customers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Roen

texts.en:
Roen is 53 years old and married with five children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey District, Battambang Province. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on five hectare of farmland. She has been doing this for 33 years. The current business earns her about 40,000KHR per day. She manages to save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her rice business. 

Roen has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely repaid the past loans. These loans have helped her improve her family's livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan from VisionFund for 4,000,000KHR. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and to plough the paddy rice. She hopes her crop yields will become more profitable so as to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mary Galla

texts.en:
Mary Galla is 41 years old and lives in Tuburan Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four children.

Mary Galla has a store where she sells goods and dry goods. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy more products to sell and to pay for farm maintenance.
  
Mary Galla has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to renovate her store to make it bigger and wider.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store and pay for farm maintenance.

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Leticia Liliana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Leticia, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  8 y 7 años de edad que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su marido se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana sobre todo en las mañanas ya que a estas horas están sus hijas están en la escuela y se le hace más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene dos años y medio  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, le gusta su trabajo ya que no le impide estar con sus hijas y ayudarlas cuando la necesitan.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos ya que quiere aprovechar las ofertas y ventas en este mes que es muy buenas. Lleva más de 2 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The “Camino Al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton that’s known for its pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renowned both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Leticia, 25, lives here.  She’s married and has two daughters who are 8 and 7 years old and are attending school.  Her husband works in construction.

She’s a housewife who in order to earn her own income to help her husband sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week mostly in the morning which is when her daughters are in school and it’s easier for her to make her rounds then.  She sells on credit and collects payment biweekly.  She’s been in this business for two and a half years and does very well.  She likes her work because it doesn’t prevent her from being with her daughters and helping them when they need it.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics she needs because she wants to take advantage of special offers this month that are very good.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than two years and likes it because the loans are easy to get.  Her dream is to give her daughters the best.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa tiene 28 años, tiene tres hijos y vive en la casa que compró con las ganancias que obtuvo laborando como jornalera. 
Hace un año empezó con la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y refrescos). Gracias a este negocio puede solventar los gastos escolares de sus hijos, ya que es padre y madre para ellos. Ahora anhela ampliar su tienda ofreciendo más productos, pero en mayores proporciones, para que así venda al por mayor y menor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que la gente le da ánimo para que siga adelante hasta hacer crecer su tienda.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida con la oportunidad que lo brindan, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. Además, agradece a su banco comunal, por la responsabilidad que tienen cada uno de sus socios y por aceptar su ingreso.
Con este préstamo, de 2,500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes con la finalidad de surtir su tienda y no sólo ofrecer bebidas.
texts.en:
Marisa, 28, has three children and lives in the house she bought with her earnings from working as a day laborer.

A year ago she started selling beverages (carbonated drinks and soft drinks).  Thanks to this business she can pay her children's school expenses, because she is father and mother to them.  Now she wants to expand her store to sell more products, but in greater proportions so she will sell both wholesale and retail.  What she likes most about her job is that the people inspire her to get ahead and expand her store.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity she is being given.  She promises to make her payments punctually.  She also thanks her communal bank for the responsibility that each member has and for accepting her as a member.

With this loan for 2,500 soles [PEN] she will invest in buying groceries to stock her store and sell more than just beverages.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from the Tbaung Khmum District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, Norn is 33 years old. He is a married father of two dependent children, both of whom are still in school. Norn has been a rice farmer on one hectare of farmland for 11 years and supplements the family’s income by growing cassava on two hectares of farmland. The current business earns about 12,000KHR per day. He manages to save about 2,000KHR each day after covering expenses. 

Norn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid his loan. The other members of his group have been with VisionFund for one or two cycles. His first loan helped him better support his family. Now he and his group members are requesting a loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000KHR each. Nom, the group leader, is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and pay for labor. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income from the current business so as to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anna Jean

texts.en:
Anna Jean is 38 years old and married with four children aged two, three, 13 and 15. She is from the town of Bien Unido in Bohol. Anna Jean is engaged in a business ferrying residents from their islands to the town of Talibon via passenger boat. Talibon is like a city to most people because its trading and business activities. She also sells ice to fishermen to preserve their fish for an additional income. Her business has been very helpful to the residents of their island. So far, her business is doing well, but since she has children to look after, she needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy diesel for the boat and ice for the fishermen. 

Her income will help support her children's education and her family's daily expenses. In the future, she hopes to have another boat that to grow her business for a better income.

loans.use: to buy diesel for her boat and ice for fishermen.

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Chhom, aged 25, is a diligent farmer living in the Prey Chor District, Kampong Cham Province. He has been working on one and a half hectares of farmland to generate his family's main income. His wife always works alongside him in the field to grow healthier rice crops and maintain a high production each harvest season. To supplement to his income, Chhom is involved in a recycling business. He buys and sells recycled materials to a local industry.  

In order to sustain his business and to earn a consistent income to satisfy their living needs, Chhom is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase recycled materials. Chhom would like to ensure the proper growth of his businesses to be able to secure the welfare of his family. He hopes that someday he will become financially stable so that his child can have more education.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials.

loans.name: Chivatsi

texts.en:
Chivatsi is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Chivatsi has been working hard selling veterinary medicine door-to-door.

To help expand his business, Chivatsi has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner, Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more medicine, and will help him to generate greater profits and grow his income to sustain his family. His target customers are livestock keepers. Chivatsi hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business and have a veterinary practice.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Sreyla's Group

texts.en: Sreyla, 19, lives with her husband in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband earn a living through rice farming on 1.5 hectares of farmland and supplement the family’s income by planting cassava on one hectare of farmland. The business earns her about KHR10,000 per day and she manages to save about KHR4,000 per day after daily expenses. This is the first loan for Sreyla’s group with VisionFund. She is leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR1,000,000 each. Sreyla is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the business and in turn make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Patricia Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno de 3  años y el menor un bebe de tres meses de nacido. El marido trabaja en una fábrica de madera.
 
Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa la misma que hace poco y con la ayuda del crédito que recibió de la institución pudo hacer realidad su sueño, allí vende de todo un poco aunque aún le falta mucho para poder surtir por completo su tienda, es por eso que solicito un nuevo crédito para poder comprar un poco mas de mercaderia para darle a sus clientes lo que necesitan y así logara mas clientela, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00. Tiene recién cuatro meses con su negocio y le gusta ya que se gana algo sin tener que descuidar su hogar y sus hijos que necesitan muchos cuidados.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 2 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Camino Al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton that’s known for its pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renowned both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Patricia, 21, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children, a three-year-old boy and a three-month-old baby.  Her husband works in a sawmill.

She has a small store at home that she was able to start a short while ago with help the institution gave her to make her dream a reality.  She sells a little bit of everything there although she still lacks much more in order to completely stock her store which is why she’s asking for a new loan to buy more merchandise and be able to give her customers everything they need thus winning over more clientele.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm.  She’s been in business four months and likes it because she can earn income without having to neglect her home; her children require much care.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, canned goods and other basic staple items.  She’s been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes it because she’s made many friendships in the group.  Her goal is to continue in business and that the store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 45 años, vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposo, Benito de 49 años. Tienen cuatro hijos.
A ella le gusta el trabajo de campo, ya que desde muy pequeña aprendió sobre los cultivos de cacao y café. Desde que obtuvo su parcela no dudó en labrar su tierra para cultivar plantas de cacao, porque los considera muy rentables. Esta labor la realiza hace 28 años, tiene su propia parcela y una de las cosas que más le gusta es cosechar los frutos de cacao con las personas de su comunidad que le apoyan en las cosechas. Vende su producción a los centros de acopio, donde le remuneran un buen precio por cada kilogramo de cacao. Su mayor anhelo es comprar otro terreno y seguir cultivando cacao, pero ahora prioriza realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos para su próxima cosecha. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan. Se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas  de pago para que en otra oportunidad logre acceder a otro crédito. En su banco comunal se siente tranquila al saber que cuenta con el apoyo y consejos de sus compañeros.
Con los 4,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus plantas de cacao, con el apoyo de jornaleros que contratará.
texts.en:
Maximina, 45, lives in the house she bought with her husband, Benito, 49.  They have four children.

She likes farm labor because from a very young age she learned about cacao and coffee plants.  Since she got her plot of land she hasn't hesitated to work it to grow cacao plants because she considers them very profitable.  She has done this work for 28 years.  She has her own plot of land and one of the things she likes most is to harvest the cacao with the people from her community who help her with the harvest.  She sells her crop to the distribution centers, where they give her a good price per kilogram of cacao.

Her greatest desire is to buy another plot of land and continue growing cacao, but now her priority is to do crop maintenance for her next harvest.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the help it gives her.  She promises to be punctual with her payments so she will have the opportunity to get another loan.  In her communal bank she is happy to know that she has the support and advice of her partners.

With the 4,000 nuevos soles [PEN] from this loan she will buy bags of manure to fertilize her cacao plants with the help of the day laborers she will hire.

loans.use: to buy bags of manure to fertilize her cacao plants

loans.name: Hoer's Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years, Hoer is a married mother of five children. She lives with her family in a rural area of the Thmor Koul District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has earned a living farming rice for twenty years while her husband is a fisherman to earn extra income. The current business makes almost 20,000KHR per day. Hoer manages to save about 6,000KHR each day after covering their daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her field business. 

Hoer, the group leader, has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other member just started with VisionFund. Hoer successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to afford food for the family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of 600,000KHR each. Hoer is going to use her portion to buy a fishing net for her husband’s business. She hopes to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is a 48-year-old married woman with five children from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have a fishing business.
Angeles does her best to contribute to her family's earnings. She has been working in the business for the past five years.
Angeles is asking for a loan worth 3000PHP to buy fishing nets and repair the boat. She hopes this loan will help improve their business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Soknin

texts.en:
Soknin, aged 25 years, is married. She has two dependent children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are under school-age. Soknin lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham Province’s Tbaung Khmum District, Cambodia. She earns a living farming rice on 0.7 hectares of farmland and supplements the family’s income by growing cassava on three hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for several years. Soknin can earn about 30,000KHR per day from the current business and manages to save about KHR10,000 after covering expenses. 

Soknin is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan from VisionFund for 2,500,000KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her farming business will be more productive. She also hopes to sell the cassava for a good price in the market so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is a 53-year-old married mother of six children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of the Battambang province in Cambodia. The main source of the family’s income comes from growing corn on 1.5 hectares farmland. Sokhom earns additional income by raising pigs. She has been in this business for several years. She is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day to support her family's needs.

This is the first loan for Sokhom’s Group of two with VisionFund. She and her group member are seeking a loan of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, Sokhom is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from her current business so she can earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 27 years old. He is married and does not yet have any children.

Samson is known for being a hardworking person with many entrepreneurial ideas. He has a charcoal store which helps him generate income to support his family.

He is applying for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal in order to satisfy the demands of his customers. He hopes that will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maranatha Lom Group

texts.en:
Kimneng (the one raising her hand in the photo) is a single woman with nine children to look after. Her husband passed away two years ago. Since then, she has been selling vegetables in the local market. 

Every morning she goes to the nearby villages to purchase vegetables from the farmers. She buys and transports these vegetables to the market and resells them. 

She requests a loan to enable her to purchase vegetables and other saleable items in large quantity to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and other saleable items for resale.

loans.name: Suot

texts.en:
Suot is 52 years old. She has three children who are adults. She has been a farmer for 10 years. She gets 2,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month. 

She has participated in the crediting program of SEDA since 2009. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to upgrade her farm of chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to upgrade her farm of chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is 54 years old.  She has two adult children.  She has a transportation service.  Her income is about 10,000,000 VND a month, and she has participated in SEDA's crediting program since 2009.  During the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time.  In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more car to enlarge her transportation service.

loans.use: to buy more car to enlarge her transportation service.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is 52 years old, and has one adult child.  She has been a farmer for 10 years, and earns 5,000,000 VND per month.  She has taken part in SEDA’s crediting program since 2009.
